---
title: "Debug Mode"
extensions:
  details:
    debug: true
filters: [details]
---

Enable verbose logging to troubleshoot configuration issues.

## Configuration

```yaml
---
extensions:
  details:
    debug: true
---
```

## What Gets Logged

When debug mode is enabled, the filter logs:

- **Initialization:** Options parsed from metadata
- **Format detection:** Whether output is interactive or not
- **Summary extraction:** Source of summary (attribute, div, heading, default)
- **ID generation:** Custom or auto-generated IDs
- **Content filtering:** Conditional content decisions
- **Output generation:** HTML or callout creation

## Sample Log Output

```default
[details] Initializing options
[details] Output format interactive: true
[details] Interactive options: open=false, summary_text='Click to expand'
[details] Non-interactive options: display=show, callout_type=note
[details] Processing details div
[details] Summary from attribute: 'Example Section'
[details] Generated ID: 'details-1'
[details] Processing HTML: id=details-1, open=false, group=nil, mode=exclusive
```

## Disable for Production

Remember to disable debug mode for production builds:

```yaml
---
extensions:
  details:
    debug: false
---
```

Failure to do so may expose internal processing details to end users, clutter logs, and impact performance.
